comments:
Reporter: Brook Zhang
OS:  Windows 2003 Standard Edition & SLES 9 beta3 & RHEL WS 3.0 -GTK
Language: CHS/CHT/Korean
Build level: 200404190838(wswb-I20040413-200404191247)   
JDK Version: IBM JDK 1.4.2 Beta
Test case #:    
Summary: DBCS:Error log is displayed when you built the SC in CDT

Description:
Steps to recreate problem:
1-In a file manager outside Eclipse, create a directory called <NLdir> 
containing ?Test.h?.
2-Change the makefile?s compiler line to point to that path g++ -c -I<NLpath> 
$^ -o $@
3-In Eclipse, select File->New->Project... In the New Project dialog, select 
C++/Standard Make C++ Project. Click Next. Enter the name ?SC?. Click Next. In 
the Binary Parser tab, select PE Windows Parser for Windows or Elf Parser for 
linux in the drop down box. Click Next.  In the Paths and Symbols page, check 
the Automate discovery of paths and symbols box. Click Finish. Click Yes if the 
Confirm Perspective Switch dialog pops up. 
4.In the C/C++ Projects view, right click on the SC project and select Import. 
In the Import dialog, Select File System. Click Next. Enter the path to the 
TestData/SC in the From directory: field. Click Select All, check Overwrite 
existing folders without warning, then click Finish.
5.Right click on the project SC and select Rebuild project. 
<<Error>>   
          DBCS:Error log is displayed when you built the SC in CDT
<<Expected Result>>
          DBCS:No Error log is displayed when you built the SC in CDT

Created an attachment (id=9767)
Error Log file

DBCS:Error log is displayed when you built the SC in CDT
This was already fixed, you will need to delete the .cdtproject file to fix this.

I can't delete the .cdtproject file in Navigator view.I tried to delete the 
context of .cdtproject file,but the error log will occur when you saved this 
empty .cdtproject file.So I don't understand your means.How to delete 
the .cdtproject file?please response me ,thanks.

The file will be rebuilt when deleted, so after you deleted it the first time
the file should have been be rebuilt with the correct character encoding (utf-8)
and the problem should go away.

I tried to deleted .cdtproject file, the error log is disappear.But this 
premise is that you must build this project first.If I deleted this .cdtproject 
before building this project,the error will come up .So I think this is a 
defect also.Can I verify this on next available build?

Is it the same error? if so then you don't have the correct build, if it is
different then please report it as a bug and attach the log.
